page.title: 20Stanfield Water Tower
page.content: Stanfield water tower is westwards from Brisley school and placed by the Stanfield turkey farm.We estimate the tower at 20m high. The tower was opened in 1967 and the water comes from Beetley bore hole on the common. The tower was built in Stanfield because it was in a high point and to let the water flow down hill. Water is pumped from the bore hole in Beetley and stored in the tank of the water tower, it then flows by gravity to the houses in Beetley, Brisley, Horningtoft and Stanfield.
